focus_skills: Systems of equations in two variables

questions.question: If <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, which of the following is a possible value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Rearrange the equation: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Thus <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Among the choices, <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> is option A.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For 'which is a possible value' questions involving quadratics, you can often test each choice directly in the original equation.

questions.question: The line <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math> passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>m</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> into the equation: <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Subtract 4: <math><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math>. Divide by 2: <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find a missing constant in a linear equation, plug the coordinates of a known point into the equation and solve.

questions.question: If <math><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Square both sides: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>49</mn></math>. Subtract 5: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>44</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving radical equations, isolate the radical first, then square both sides. Remember to check for extraneous solutions if the original equation had restrictions.

questions.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> for all <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Factor the numerator: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Then <math><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For equivalent expression problems, factor numerators and denominators to simplify rational expressions.

questions.skill: Systems of equations in two variables
questions.question: For what value of <math><mi>k</mi></math> does the system of equations <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> have exactly one real solution?
questions.explanation: Set the expressions equal: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Rearrange: <math><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. For exactly one real solution, the discriminant must be zero: <math><msup><mn>6</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><mn>36</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Solve: <math><mn>12</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>, <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a line and a parabola to intersect at exactly one point, the discriminant of the resulting quadratic equation must be zero.

questions.question: If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math>, what is the sum of the possible values of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Expand: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math>. Subtract 18: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>28</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Solutions: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Sum: <math><mn>7</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a quadratic equation in the form ax^2+bx+c=0, the sum of the solutions is -b/a.

questions.skill: Systems of equations in two variables
questions.question: A system of equations consists of <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. For which value of <math><mi>m</mi></math> will the system have exactly one real solution?
questions.explanation: Set equal: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Rearrange: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. For one solution, discriminant = 0: <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. So <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>, giving <math><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Thus <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> or <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math>. Among the choices, only <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> (option A) appears.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Set the equations equal, form a quadratic, and set the discriminant to zero to find the condition for exactly one intersection.

questions.question: What are the solutions to <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Factor: <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Set each factor to zero: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>; <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When factoring quadratics with a leading coefficient not 1, look for factor pairs of ac that add to b.

questions.question: If <math><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>, which equation expresses <math><mi>s</mi></math> in terms of <math><mi>p</mi></math> and <math><mi>r</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Multiply both sides by <math><mi>s</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math>: <math><mi>p</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>r</mi></math>. Divide by <math><mi>p</mi></math>: <math><mi>s</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>r</mi></mrow><mi>p</mi></mfrac></math>. Add 4: <math><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>r</mi></mrow><mi>p</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To solve for a variable in the denominator, first multiply both sides by the denominator to clear the fraction.

questions.question: If <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>21</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>? (If there is more than one solution, enter the greater solution.)
questions.explanation: Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Solutions: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. The greater solution is <math><mn>7</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When asked for the greater (or lesser) solution of a quadratic, find both solutions first, then compare.

questions.skill: Systems of equations in two variables
questions.question: The system of equations <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math> has exactly one real solution. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Set equal: <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Rearrange: <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. For one solution, discriminant = 0: <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math> → <math><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Thus <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> or <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Among the options, <math><mn>7</mn></math> is choice C.
questions.score_improvement_tip: After substituting, form a quadratic and set its discriminant to zero. Remember, the discriminant must be a perfect square to yield rational k.

questions.question: How many distinct real solutions does the equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> have?
questions.explanation: Let <math><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Then <math><msup><mi>u</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>u</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. So <math><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> or <math><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Then <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. So there are 4 distinct real solutions.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For equations that are quadratic in form (like ax^4+bx^2+c=0), use substitution u=x^2 to turn it into a quadratic.

questions.skill: Systems of equations in two variables
questions.question: The graphs of <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi></math> intersect at exactly one point. What is a possible value of <math><mi>m</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Set equal: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi></math> → <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. For exactly one intersection, discriminant = 0: <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>36</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math> → <math><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Thus <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> or <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. One possible value is <math><mn>0</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a line through the origin (y=mx) to be tangent to a parabola, the discriminant of the resulting quadratic must be zero.

questions.question: If <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Cross-multiply: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Expand: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Cancel <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and 6: <math><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. Add <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi></math>: <math><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Thus <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For rational equations, cross-multiply (being mindful of domain restrictions) and solve the resulting linear equation.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M 100 250 Q 200 50 300 250' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' fill='none'/><text x='280' y='110' font-size='14'>y = x + 1</text><text x='280' y='270' font-size='14'>y = x² - 4x + 6</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A line with positive slope and a parabola opening upward. The line and parabola intersect at two points.
questions.question: The graphs of the equations <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math> are shown in the xy‑plane. How many solutions does the system have?
questions.explanation: Set the expressions equal: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Rearrange: <math><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. The discriminant is <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, which is positive. Therefore, the quadratic has two distinct real roots, so the system has two solutions.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M 100 250 Q 200 50 300 250' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' fill='none'/><circle cx='150' cy='200' r='4' fill='red'/><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='150' y='190' font-size='12'>Intersection</text><text x='250' y='90' font-size='12'>Intersection</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Same line and parabola as in the question, with two intersection points highlighted.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The number of intersections between a line and a parabola corresponds to the number of real solutions when you set the equations equal.

questions.question: For what value of <math><mi>c</mi></math> does the equation <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> have exactly one real solution?
questions.explanation: A quadratic has exactly one real solution when its discriminant is zero: <math><msup><mn>8</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><mn>64</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>64</mn></math> → <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize the discriminant condition: one real solution ↔ b² - 4ac = 0.

questions.question: If <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>, which equation expresses <math><mi>b</mi></math> in terms of <math><mi>a</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Multiply both sides by <math><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>: <math><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Distribute: <math><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Gather b terms: <math><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi></math>. Factor b: <math><mi>b</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi></math>. Divide: <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>. This matches option A.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving for a variable that appears in the denominator, clear the fraction first, then isolate that variable.

questions.skill: Systems of equations in two variables
questions.question: If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is a solution to the system <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, and <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> is the x-coordinate, substitute <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> into the first equation: <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn></math>. So <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>11</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Substitute into the second equation: <math><mn>11</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>. Thus <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If you know one coordinate of a solution, substitute it into one equation to find the other coordinate, then use the second equation to find the constant.

questions.question: What is the sum of the solutions to <math><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>|</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: The equation <math><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>|</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> means <math><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Solve: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Sum: <math><mn>14</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For |x - h| = c, the solutions are x = h ± c. Their sum is 2h.

questions.skill: Systems of equations in two variables
questions.question: The system <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>p</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math> has exactly one real solution. What is the value of <math><mi>p</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Note: The question asks for p but the quadratic is x² - 6x + 8, so p = -6. To verify, set equal: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math> → <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> → <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, which has exactly one solution. So p = -6.
questions.score_improvement_tip: After substitution, the condition for a single solution is that the resulting quadratic has discriminant zero. Use this to solve for the parameter.
